text: Mormoscopa sordescens is a moth of the family Noctuidae first described by Rudolph Rosenstock in 1885."Species Mormoscopa sordescens (Rosenstock, 1885)". Australian Faunal Directory. Archived 3 August 2012. It is known from Australia, including Queensland and New South Wales. The wingspan is about . Adults are brown with a pale scalloped margin to each wing. ==References== Category:Herminiinae Category:Moths described in 1885 Category:Moths of Australia
title: Mormoscopa sordescens
